intro: Scrophularia glabella, commonly known as common figwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scrophularia glabella is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry meadows.
